alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 11:46PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of panhandle Nebraska, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1046 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gordon, Rushville, Clinton and Lone Butte. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
